util

Class TimeStamp

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.TimeStamp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<TimeStamp>

    public class TimeStamp
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<TimeStamp>
    a simple class to manage our days. It does not represent a calenderday but rather a working day with a worktime, which is the standard worktime diminished by the overtime of the day before

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TimeStamp(int day, int time, int overtime)
      creates a new timestamp with given daynumber and worktime, adjusted with the given overtime.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimeStamp

        public TimeStamp(int day,
         int time,
         int overtime)
        creates a new timestamp with given daynumber and worktime, adjusted with the given overtime. If the overtime exceeds the maximum overtime, this maximum overtime will be used instead.
        Parameters:
        day - number of the day.
        overtime - overtime of the day before.

    • Method Detail

      • FirstDay

        public static TimeStamp FirstDay()
        Returns:
        new timestamp at beginning of a first day (number==1). The Day has the standard worktime.

      • getWorkTime

        public int getWorkTime()

      • getNextDay

        public TimeStamp getNextDay()
        This function initializes the next day based on the current day it automatically passes the time that was worked too much today
        Returns:
        timestamp at the beginning of the next Day

      • getDay

        public int getDay()
        inspector for the day variable
        Returns:
        the daynumber of this timestamp

      • getTime

        inspector for the time variable
        Returns:
        time in minutes

        public int getOverTime()
        inspector for the overtime
        Returns:
        overtime of the day before

      • shouldBeFinishedAfter

        public boolean shouldBeFinishedAfter(int additionalTime)
        inspector that calculates that the day should be finished if we add additional time to this day
        Parameters:
        additionalTime -
        Returns:
        true if current time + additionalTime >= today's worktime

      • shouldBeFinished

        public boolean shouldBeFinished()
        inspector that calculates if the day should be finished base on the current time
        Returns:
        true if current time >= today's worktime
